result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:54 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bradley Leroy Triebold in court.  Attorney T. Gregory Amann in court for Bradley Leroy Triebold. Court reviews file, notes information from counsel regarding agreement. Court cancels JT and sets PLEAS. DE confirms address and phone number. Adjourned: 4:01 PM. kma
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pretrial letter to Atty Amann. Filed by ADA Smestad. arc   e: Atty Amann

Final pre-trial on October 24, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Jury trial on November 16, 2022 at 08:00 am.

- AMENDED

- Bond on file

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least TWO times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges. I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  M.R.K.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

- If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

04:01 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY: T. Gregory Amann, DF: Bradley Leroy Triebold appeared.  Court reviews file.  Atty Amann states parties are still negotiating but believes setting for trial is appropriate.   Cut off for negotiations is 10/24/22.  If no agreement is reached all motions, jury instructions and witness lists are due by 10/28/22.  Atty Amann would like to amend bond, makes argument.  Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

- AMENDED on 4/4/2022: During Defendant's business hours, M.R.K. may resume employment for and with Defendant.  

- Miss Kristopherson to relocate by Wednesday 2/2/22. DE can return home and run business on Thursday on 2/3/22, SCSO to confirm Kristopherson has moved out before DE can return.  

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least TWO times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges. I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT (during defendant's business hours or in any therapeutic settings) whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, M.R.K. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, M.R.K. (outside of defendant's business hours). The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:00 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: S. Fox, ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad via zoom, DF ATTY:  T. Gregory Amann and DF:  Bradley Leroy Triebold appeared in person. Victim appears with V/W. Court reviews case. ADA Smestad states an offer has been made just today. Court addresses bond. Atty Amann states Def has been attending counseling.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:48 PM   Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: S. Fox, ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad via zoom, DF ATTY:  T. Gregory Amann, DF:  Bradley Leroy Triebold appeared. Victim in court with V/W.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Not Guilty pleas entered.  Discovery has been received today. Atty Amann is anticipating motions. Court sets a PTC. Bond continues. Court approves zoom appearance at the next hearing if for scheduling only. Victim requests to amend bond. Court does not amend bond at this time. Court to review bond at the next hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:05 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Francis D. Collins, DF ATTY: T. Gregory Amann, DF: Bradley Leroy Triebold appeared.  S/T of Deputy Benjamin Trebian of SCSO.  Direct by ADA Collins.  Cross by Atty. Amann.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. ADA Collins would like court to discuss bond modification.  Victim makes statement.  ADA Collins doesn't object to DE being able to run business from home. Court will amend bond, victim to relocate and once relocated DE can return home.  Adjourned at 11:34. bph  Arraignment scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
